overview: This measure has been amended to incorporate ten additional claims that have been resolved, increasing the total number of claims from twenty-one to thirty-one. The bill's purpose remains to appropriate funds for claims against the State, its officers, or its employees. The scope has expanded to cover newly resolved settlements and judgments involving additional state departments, including the Department of Health and Department of Human Services.
appropriations: The total appropriation for fiscal year 2024-2025 has increased to $7,854,458.74 to satisfy thirty-one claims. This new total consists of a general fund appropriation of $6,444,458.74 and a departmental fund appropriation of $1,410,000.00. The additional funds cover ten newly added claims resolved since the last version of the measure.
agency_impact: The list of impacted agencies has been further expanded to include the Department of Health and the Department of Human Services. These departments will be responsible for processing payments related to the newly added claims. The Department of Transportation's liability from departmental funds also increases with the addition of a new settlement.
revenue_sources: The funding sources remain the state's general revenues and departmental funds. The amount appropriated from general revenues has increased to $6,444,458.74 to cover nine new claims. The appropriation from departmental funds has also increased to $1,410,000.00 to cover an additional claim against the Department of Transportation.
six_year_fiscal_implications: The one-time expenditure in fiscal year 2024-2025 has increased to a total of $7,854,458.74. This updated total reflects the addition of ten new claims since the previous draft, increasing the number of claims from twenty-one to thirty-one. The general fund portion of this cost is now $6,444,458.74, and the departmental fund portion is $1,410,000.00. The newly added claims include settlements for the Department of Health ($348,000.00), a judgment against the Department of Human Services ($512,700.83), and an additional settlement for the Department of Transportation ($70,000.00). Other additions include claims for the Judiciary, the Department of Land and Natural Resources, and several miscellaneous claims. These appropriations are for specific settlements, judgments, and reissuance of checks and do not create recurring costs. Any unencumbered funds will lapse on June 30, 2026. This measure does not create any new positions or ongoing operational expenses.
updates_from_previous_fiscal_note: The primary update is the increase in the total appropriation from $6,498,867.07 to $7,854,458.74. This change results from adding ten new claims totaling $1,355,591.67, increasing the total number of claims from twenty-one to thirty-one. Consequently, the general fund appropriation has increased to $6,444,458.74, the departmental fund appropriation has increased to $1,410,000.00, and the list of impacted agencies now includes the Department of Health and the Department of Human Services.
